title: Father Coughlin church acknowledges antisemitism , updates legacy
message:
Now, nine decades later, his church is officially declaring him an antisemite - and educating visitors about his legacy of hate.
But almost 60 years after Coughlin’s retirement, many members of the church community had never heard of him or his legacy among Jews.
Church acknowledges Father Coughlin's antisemitismDetroit’s Jews, many of whom live within a few miles of the church, have petitioned the Shrine for years to better acknowledge its painful history.
And the Shrine has taken steps to grapple with Coughlin’s antisemitism.
The changes were then approved by the Archdiocese, the same body that had condoned Coughlin’s antisemitism for years as he spewed it from the airwaves.

title: SJM equips students to deal with antisemitism
message:
Browse > Home News / SJM equips students to deal with antisemitism – J-WireSJM equips students to deal with antisemitismRead on for articleEach year, 35,000 students visit the Sydney Jewish Museum to learn about the impact of the Holocaust by meeting survivors and taking part in a series of specialist workshops.
Today, these workshops have taken on added importance, because they equip students with the tools and understanding to allow them to stand up in their communities to combat discrimination, racism and antisemitism.
The rise of antisemitism in Australia has been particularly distressing to many Holocaust survivors, including those who every day speak to students at the Sydney Jewish Museum.
What has followed from this is that the Sydney Jewish Museum has fundamentally shifted the way it will address learnings from the Holocaust and respond to the distressing levels of antisemitism.
It is also working to develop a major behaviour-changing campaign targeting antisemitism amongst Generation Z on social media.
